trustfund:
TF024256-BALTIC-RIGA REGIONAL MISSION,TF039182-LATVIA - RURAL DEVELOPMENT
            PROJECT - LATVIAN NATIONAL LANDBOOK,TF029689-PHRD-AGRICULTURAL DEV. II PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is highly
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts are high. Lessons learned suggest that
            for successful rural finance, four key elements play a
            significant role: legally based property ownership;
            functional legal systems; functional financial institutions;
            and, a system of effective farm advisory and business
            development support. To this end, prerequisites, such as the
            development of a property registration system, land markets,
            collateral registration, and mortgages, should be
            synchronized for the development of physical assets, and
            financial markets. However, in the provision of financial
            subsidies to the rural sector - through innovative hybrid
            grant-loans - such loans should be restricted to first-time
            borrowers only, with the understanding that the subsidy is a
            one-time catalyst, and not a recurring government handout.
            Additionally, tying the grant to a bank loan, conditions
            sub-borrowers to the discipline of loan payments, allowing
            the establishment of a credit history. Similarly, grant-loan
            credit lines for small loans, can effectively promote the
            establishment of new businesses in rural areas, thereby
            diversifying the rural economic base.
